programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The inhabitants of Midsomer Magna are in the spotlight, quite literally when a production crew descend on the village and imposing Manor House. To film a version of The Scarlet Pimpernel. Not only the film crew arrive, but a notorious criminal as well, George Ince, lurking around the Manor. When Nick Cheney, the film's director is found dead, by the use of the prop guillotine. The detectives need to sift through many motives which lead to the complexity.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Midsomer Holm, a rehabilitation scheme for reformed criminals continues. When Ronnie Tyler departs, he gets a good send off from everyone, including DCI Barnaby. Another attendee is Jack Colby, a disgraced ex-policeman and former colleague of Barnaby. Jack is decidedly frosty towards his once-former friend and refuses to chat. When Jack is later murdered, Barnaby must search for answers in Jack's past for motives.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Causton is buzzing at the opening of a new brewery on the site of a famously cursed Abbey.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Winter are thrust into a crime that impacts not only on their community, but internationally.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Carver Valleys comic festival is in full swing when the village is shocked by the murder of a former model.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A death at the local Rugby Club sends Barnaby and Winter into a muddle of rucks.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is less than impressed when Sarah drags him to a family friends wedding.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Emily Simpson is found dead in her house, DCI Barnaby's instincts all lead him to suspect murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A writers' circle are about to witness a sequence of gruesome events far stranger than any fiction.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The peace of Ferne Basset is shattered when the body of quiet animal lover Agnes Gray is bludgeoned to death and found floating in the nearby river. The case is far from easy, when her cousin, Esslyn Carmichael, inadvertently cuts his own throat on stage during the final act of a production of Amadeus. Many of the village and of the Causton Amateur Dramatics' Society loathed him.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The villagers of Morton Fendle are up in arms when they discover the local craft centre, which they had invested in, is in financial uncertainty. As Barnaby tries to stop matters from escalating, he soon learns that its owner Alan Hollingsworth's wife Simone has been kidnapped. Shortly after following Alan to the nearby market town, and witnessing him dropping off a valise, a neighbor of his is murdered when her car is forced off the road and collides with a stationary log lorry.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Bill Carter, one of the founders of a New Age commune called the 'Lodge of the Golden Windhorse', dies after falling down the stairs and breaking his neck. Barnaby and Troy arrive to investigate and meet many of the commune's quirky residents. They need to work out whether it was just an unfortunate accident or murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.sub-title: Things That Go Bump In The Night
programme.desc: Undertaker Patrick Pennyman is found dead in the village of Fletcher's Cross, in his own chapel of rest, by his wife. Barnaby and Scott start looking into a spiritualist church in the village that had been heavily controversial. Elizabeth, a friend of Joyce, who had attended their meetings, tells her that she was suspicious of both the spiritualist church and the undertaker and believed they were acquiring information and stealing from the dead.
